page.title: 14GAINFORD SPA
page.content: { {The Spa}is a font like structure situated between Gainford and Winston beside the{River Tees.}Last century it was described as a sulphurous spring. It smells like rotten eggs but tastes like drinking water. The{mineral water came out of rocks into the spa, which now flows into the river. It was thought that the{spa water}would attract many people and Gainford would become a holiday centre. Houses were built along{South View}in{Gainford}for people to come from all over the country to sample some of the mineral water which was said to have{special {healing qualities.}Unfortunately,the tourist attraction did not flourish, and today the spa is only of local interest. The boarding houses are now used as people's homes.
